page.title: 14HARROLD BRIDGE
page.content: There has been a bridge over the River Ouse at Harrold since Roman times. The present bridge dates back to the l3th. century. In the middle part of the bridge are four arches.Each arch was the responsibility of the Lord of the Manor of each of the parishes which met at the bridge, viz.Odell, Chellington, Carlton and Harrold. The arches of the first three villages were made of stone and pointed; that of Harrold was wooden and square..! Nowadays the bridge carries much traffic and traffic lights have had to be installed.
